info.headline: Flood Advisory issued April 29 at 12:49PM CDT until April 29 at 2:15PM CDT by NWS Springfield MO
info.description:
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues.
* WHERE...Portions of southeast Kansas, including the following county, Crawford and southwest Missouri, including the following counties, Barton and Jasper.
* WHEN...Until 215 PM CDT.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1247 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated that the heavy rainfall had ended, however runoff from the earlier heavy rain will continue into early this afternoon. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - This includes the following low water crossings... East Fork Dry Wood Creek at NW 110th Lane and Muddy Creek at Highway 126. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Lamar, Golden City, Liberal, Mulberry, Mindenmines, Nashville, Lamar Heights, Irwin, Burgess, Milford, Oakton, Iantha, Boston, Verdella, Kenoma, Hannon and Prairie State Park. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Many flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 215 PM CDT THIS AFTERNOON

area.areaDesc: Crawford, KS; Barton, MO; Jasper, MO
